Articles.Content:
Hi, I am currently having an issue with the KerbNet feature as of the 1.3 update. Prior to the update, I could use KerbNet with any probe body with no problem. Now, all I get is this when I open up the access window:

The only mods I have installed are Kerbal Alarm Clock and a planet pack, but KerbNet worked fine with these same mods in 1.2.2. Does anyone know what I could do to fix this? Thanks in advance!

edit: solved, kopernicus is currently having some issues with scanners, just gonna have to deal with it.

Edited July 2, 2017 by TheWanderer05
SOLVED

Turn the probe on and off again?

Nah. I recommend trying it without the mods. Since you're using mods from 1.2.2 on a 1.3 save, there may be compatibility issues. Either you can revert the game back to 1.2.2 or get rid of the mods to see if it would correct itself.
That's weird - according to the wiki, you should be fine. Try stripping off mods or in a sandbox.

On 6/27/2017 at 0:17 AM, Virdin said:

Turn the probe on and off again?

Nah. I recommend trying it without the mods. Since you're using mods from 1.2.2 on a 1.3 save, there may be compatibility issues. Either you can revert the game back to 1.2.2 or get rid of the mods to see if it would correct itself.

Nah, the mods are up to date. The current version of Kopernicus has issues with scanners, so I'm just gonna have to deal with it for now.
